title: IndiGo passenger arrested after 'molesting' woman sitting next to him
title_page: IndiGo passenger arrested after 'molesting' woman sitting next to him | Daily Mail Online
text:
A male plane passenger was arrested by police after he allegedly molested a woman sitting next to him mid-flight.
The shocking incident is alleged to have happened on an IndiGo Airlines flight en-route from Delhi to Kolkata in India.
After the woman began shouting at the man next to her, the pilot took the decision to make sure the passengers were separated, and on landing in Kolkata, the police were called.
The shocking incident is alleged to have happened on an IndiGo Airlines flight en-route from Delhi to Kolkata in India
IBNLive reports that a case has been filed with the Kolkata airport police, and the man was arrested at the time.
Local news sources have named the man as 50-year-old Sanjay Kanad, a businessman who works in Delhi. The victim is also believed to be from Delhi and is 30 years old.
The plane is believed to have landed on schedule despite the incident taking place.
A spokesperson for IndiGo confirmed there was an incident of 'unruly behavior' which was reported today on IndiGo flight 6E-219, travelling from Delhi to Kolkata.
The woman is said to have launched a charge of molestation against the passenger seated next to her. Both gave evidence at Kolkata airport
She said: 'While the aircraft was descending, a woman passenger who was seated on 9F had raised a concern against the co-passenger of being touched objectionably. The crew on-board escalated the concern to the security staff and the CISF.
'At IndiGo, any untoward act which compromises the dignity of passengers or crew is a serious concern.
'IndiGo personnel accompanied the parties to the police station and a criminal complaint has been lodged. The matter is being investigated by the concerned authorities.
'We deeply regret the inconvenience caused to the woman passenger on board.'
